trans-unit.source: Describes a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) contract that specifies what an endpoint communicates to the outside world.
A [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] contract is a collection of operations that specifies what the endpoint communicates to the outside world.
Each operation is a message exchange.
For example, a request message and an associated reply message form a request/reply message exchange.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> object is used to describe [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] contracts and their operations.

Within a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>, each contract operation has a corresponding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> that describes aspects of the each operation that is part of the contract, such as whether the operation is one-way or request/reply.
Each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> also describes the messages that make up the operation using a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescriptionCollection>.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> contains a reference to an interface that defines the contract using the programming model.

This interface is marked with <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceContractAttribute> and its methods that correspond to endpoint operations are marked with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute>.
A *duplex* contract defines the following logical sets of operations:
A set that the service exposes for the client to call.
A set that the client exposes for the service to call.
The programming model for defining a duplex contract is to split each set in a separate interface and apply attributes to each interface.
In this case, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> contains a reference to each of the interfaces that groups them into one duplex contract.

Similar to bindings, each contract has a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Name%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Namespace%2A> that uniquely identify it in the metadata of the service.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> class with a specified name.
The name of the contract.
name is `null`.
name is empty.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> class with a namespace-qualified name specified.
The namespace can be an empty string ("").
The name of the contract.
The namespace that contains the name of the contract.
name is `null`.
name is empty.
Gets the behaviors associated with the contract description.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior"></xref> associated with the contract description.
Gets or sets the type of callback contract that the contract description specifies.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.CallbackContractType%2A> property is not serializable, so it is only available when the description is bound to runtime.
It cannot be imported or exported as part of the metadata.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of callback contract that the contract description specifies.
Gets or sets the configuration name for the contract description.
The configuration name for the contract.
Gets the collection of behavior for the contract.
The collection of behavior for the contract.
Gets or sets the contract type that the contract description specifies.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ContractType%2A> property is not serializable, so it is only available when the description is bound to runtime.
It cannot be imported or exported as part of the metadata.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of contract that the contract description specifies.
Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and a specified type of service.

The difference between the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.GetContract%2A> overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute>).
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of contract.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> for the specified type of contract and type of service.
Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and service implementation.

The difference between the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.GetContract%2A> overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute>).
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of contract.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that implements the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> for the specified type of contract and service implementation.
Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract.

The difference between the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.GetContract%2A> overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute>).
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> for the specified type of contract.
Returns a collection of contract descriptions that are inherited by the current contract description.

The <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> that is inherited by the current contract description.
Gets a value that indicates whether the contract has had a protection level set.

When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> is set, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property is set to `true`.
`true` if the protection level has been set; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the contract.
The name of the contract description.
Gets or sets the namespace for the contract.
The namespace can be an empty string ("").
The namespace of the contract.
The value set is `null`.
Gets the collection of operation descriptions associated with the contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescriptionCollection"></xref> that contains the operation descriptions associated with the contract description.
Gets or sets the level of security protection associated with the contract.

When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> is set, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property is set to `true`.
The <xref href="System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel"></xref> for the operation.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a session is required by the contract.

A reliable session is a way of correlating a set of messages exchanged between two or more endpoints (using the [WS-ReliableMessaging](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96680) specification) to provide assurances of the reliability of the connection.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SessionMode"></xref> that specifies the support for reliable sessions that a contract requires or supports.

Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
